note_content.Chief Complaint: Recent onset of chest pain and shortness of breath.
note_content.History of Present Illness: Chest pain started 2 weeks ago, primarily with physical exertion. Shortness of breath accompanies the pain.
note_content.Past Medical History: Hypertension diagnosed 5 years ago, controlled on medication. No history of coronary artery disease.
note_content.Family History: Father had a myocardial infarction at age 60.
note_content.Social History: Currently a smoker, smoking half a pack per day for 20 years. No alcohol or drug use. Works as an accountant.
note_content.Review of Systems: Positive for fatigue and occasional dizziness. Negative for fever, weight loss, or other systemic symptoms.
note_content.Physical Examination: General appearance well-kept, mild distress evident from facial expression. Lungs clear, heart exam reveals no murmurs. Mild tenderness on palpation of the chest wall.
note_content.Investigations: ECG conducted showed T-wave inversion in leads II, III, and AVF. Chest X-ray was normal.
note_content.Assessment and Plan: Primary suspect is stable angina. Recommended stress test and consider adding aspirin and a beta-blocker to the treatment regime. Further cardiac evaluation will be scheduled within one week. Urged patient to seek immediate care if symptoms worsen.
note_content.Differential Diagnosis: Possible angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, or musculoskeletal pain.
